newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's CST plans $550 mln debt issue.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's CST plans $550 mln debt issue.

text.p: Brazilian steel slab maker Companhia Siderurgica Tubarao (CST) said it was drawing up a plan to issue $550 million of seven-year notes backed by export receivables.
"We expect the plan to be ready no later than November," Antonio Lima Filho, CST's market relations director, told reporters at a news conference.
Filho said the securities will be offered to U.S., Japanese and European institutional investors.
The operation will be coordinated abroad by Goldman Sachs and Japan's Daiwa bank. In Brazil, Bozano Simonsen and Unibanco banks are leading the deal, he said.
Filho said the debt issue will back part of the firm's investment plan of $1.2 billion through the year 2000.
